result.execSummary:
The defendant Thong Pathoumvanh was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: FTE/FT school or combination thereof, or at any time defendant does not meet that requirment, he must perform 10 hours community service.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
SAFE program.

Case called: 10:37am
State appears by ADA M.Adrian; Defendant appears by phone from WI State Prison System and by Attorney Toulouse.
(Motion to Amend JOC)

State disputes Motion to Amend filed by Atty Toulouse regarding additional credit for time served.
Argument by Atty Toulouse; Argument by State - Defendant is requesting an additional 42 days credit.
COURT directs Atty Toulouse to submit additional information to COURT within 30 days and then State to respond within 10 days thereafter.
COURT will then issue a decision.

CONDITIONS: Safe program completion; AODA and any follow up recommended; Absolute sobriety; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC including one D.A. surcharge; FTE/FT school or combination thereof, or at any time defendant does not meet that requirement, he must perform 10 hours of community service per week; N/C with victim unless as approved by PO.
